ACL Anthology Bibliography [file:acl44.bib]


Please mail corrections to doug@essex.ac.uk
[1] Fatiha Sadat and Nizar Habash. Combination of arabic preprocessing schemes for statistical machine translation. In Proceedings of the 21st International Conference on Computational Linguistics and 44th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics, pages 1-8, Sydney, Australia, July 2006. Association for Computational Linguistics.

[2] Necip Fazil Ayan and Bonnie J. Dorr. Going beyond aer: An extensive analysis of word alignments and their impact on mt. In Proceedings of the 21st International Conference on Computational Linguistics and 44th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics, pages 9-16, Sydney, Australia, July 2006. Association for Computational Linguistics.

[3] Matthew Purver, Konrad P. Körding, Thomas L. Griffiths, and Joshua B. Tenenbaum. Unsupervised topic modelling for multi-party spoken discourse. Association for Computational Linguistics.

[4] Igor Malioutov and Regina Barzilay. Minimum cut model for spoken lecture segmentation. Association for Computational Linguistics.

[5] Shane Bergsma and Dekang Lin. Bootstrapping path-based pronoun resolution. Association for Computational Linguistics.
